Autumn Statement: Reinforcing sustainable growth or reinforcing the messaging?
With this being the Chancellor’s last Autumn Statement before the General Election, he will need to balance the country’s needs with political realities.
AECOM and Construction News are pleased to host a panel of esteemed industry and government experts who will discuss and debate whether the Chancellor has taken the right measures to address the UK’s most pressing needs while also ensuring the property and construction industry is positioned for sustainable growth.
During the session, we will discuss:
Maintaining London’s global competitiveness Bridging the north-south divide Investment in hard and social infrastructure Addressing the industry’s skills shortage London’s housing demand
Panel:
Denise Chevin (Chair), Acting Editor, Construction News Rt. Hon. David Lammy MP Martin Rowark, Director of Commercial, Transport for London John Hicks, Head of Government & Public, AECOM
Further speakers to be announced.
Programme:
08.00 Registration and breakfast 08.30-09.30 Debate
On: 10 December 2014, 08.00-10.00
At: AECOM MidCity Place 71 High Holborn London WC1V 6QS
